title: Studio Ghibli Blu-Ray Steelbook Editions Discounted To As Low As $15 At Amazon
description: Studio Ghibli Movies - Limited Edition Steelbooks More than a dozen Ghibli movies have matching Blu-ray releases. See at Amazon Studio Ghibli fans can expand their Blu-ray collection for cheap this week thanks to Amazon's deals on the popular Limited Edition Steelbooks. Many of the Japanese animated studio's best films are available for $19 or less. The best part about Studio Ghibli's Steelbook Editions is that each one has the same design aesthetic, so they look great next to each other regardless of how you choose to display the colorful cases.Studio Ghibli Movies on Blu-ray - Limited Edition SteelbooksPonyo: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $15 ($27)Porco Rosso: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $17.89 ($27)From Up on Poppy Hill: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $17.89 ($27)When Marnie Was There: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $17.89 ($27)Princess Mononoke: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.43 ($27)Spirited Away: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)Kiki's Delivery Service: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)My Neighbor Totoro: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)Howl's Moving Castle: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)The Secret World of Arietty: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)The Wind Rises: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27)Only Yesterday: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $21.59 ($27)The Boy and the Heron: Steelbook Edition (4K UHD + Blu-ray) -- $30 ($45)The Tale of The Princess Kaguya: Steelbook Edition (Blu-ray) -- $18.89 ($27) | Sold outAt the moment, the cheapest Studio Ghibli Steelbook is Ponyo for $15. The beloved 2008 fantasy film was written and directed by Studio Ghibli co-founder Hayao Miyazaki. It was the highest-grossing Ghibli film in North America until The Boy and the Heron nabbed the crown last year. The Boy and the Heron is the only Ghibli film to release on 4K Blu-ray. The 4K Limited Edition Steelbook is discounted from $45 to $30.Three Limited Edition Steelbooks are up for grabs for $17.89 each: Porco Rosso, From Up on Poppy Hill, and When Marnie Was There. All three are marked as "limited-time deals" by Amazon, so these are likely to disappear at the end of the week.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Save $100 On Anker's Popular 140W Portable Battery Pack With Fast Charging
description: Amazon has a fantastic deal on Anker's popular 737 Power Bank that's definitely worth checking out before it disappears. Normally $150, you can get Anker's 140W portable laptop charger for only $50. The $100 discount is unlikely to stick around for long. Your order will ship from Amazon, but the seller of this deal is Amazon-owned retailer Woot. Get deal at Amazon Anker 737 Laptop Power Bank - 140W, 24,000mAh $50 (was $150) This power bank should be of particular interest to those with a gaming laptop or a power-hungry portable PC. Most battery packs in the $50 price range can't keep up with the power drain when gaming on a laptop. With the Anker 737, you'll be able to extend your playtime while away from an outlet.Even if you don't have a gaming laptop, this high-end battery pack is a great choice for Steam Deck, MacBooks, Nintendo Switch, smartphones, and tablets. Its 24,000mAh capacity can fully charge an iPhone 16 Pro four times.Anker is one of the most trusted names in the portable charging space, and the 737 is one of the manufacturer's most popular models thanks to its premium feature set. The battery pack has a digital display to show key figures such as input/output, the battery life of the power bank itself, and a charging time estimate for the device that's plugged into the included 140W USB-C to USB-C cable. The cable supports 3.1 fast charging for compatible devices such as smartphones and select laptops. title: It's time to play Monster Hunter again, but now you're an Orc
description: The release of Monster Hunter Wilds brought with it the usual comments about the hypocrisy of a series that wants to both protect ecosystems and grind them up for parts. "When will Monster Hunter just be honest about its desire to endlessly turn dragons into pants," we lamented to ourselves. "When will the Monster Hunters recognise - nay, embrace the fact that they are the biggest Monsters of all". We could have saved ourselves a few thousand words and just pointed at Hunters Inc, instead. It's basically a first-person low-budget Monster Hunter game in which the Hunters are Orcs. Orcs do not do self-deception, as a rule. They do not go for sanitised violence or anthropocentric fantasies about becoming "nature's caretakers". They are straightforwardly happy to club things to bits. Looks like ludonarrative consonance is back on the menu, boys! Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Microsoft fire employees who protested the sale of genAI tech to the Israeli military
description: Two Microsoft software engineers who interrupted a Microsoft anniversary event to protest against the company's dealings with the Israeli military have been fired for misconduct, according to a report. Software engineer Ibtihal Aboussad, who is based in Canada and once worked for the company's genAI division, lost her job on Monday 7th April due to "wilful misconduct, disobedience or wilful neglect of duty," according to internal documents picked up by CNBC. Another Microsoft software engineer, Vaniya Agrawal, had announced that she would resign on April 11th, but according to another document cited by CNBC, Microsoft have terminated her job in advance. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 873
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. How would you rather spend some unexpected afternoon free time: watching a movie, going for a walk or reading a book? I’d love some extra time to read! I recently found a new-to-me author that I enjoy, Rebecca Searle, and I’m going through all of her books. 2. What did you last cry about? Well, I went to the OBGYN last week, and I had a mini-meltdown when the nice nurse took my blood pressure. I think it’s a little bit of leftover post-traumatic stress from going to the doctor so much last year along with some hormonal stuff (dang this peri-menopause). 3. What would you rather do with a friend: play card games, have a picnic in the park or go to the farmers’ market? Let’s[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 873 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What could you use most right now: cuddles with pets, a hot cup of tea or a nap? I’m drinking a hot cup of tea at the moment, and I’m not too sleepy, so I’ll take the cuddles from the pets. 2. On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the highest, how concerned are you about AI? Girl. As someone who named her daughter after a great science fiction heroine who rises up to help defeat the robots, I’m going to give this a solid 10. I’m freaked out, man! 3. Something unexpected that happened to you recently? Well, I saw a bobcat out of my window when I was at work last week! (See the pic at the top.) The campus has a lot of[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
